snippet.title: Disney's The D Show (PC) Playthrough [Ep 1]
snippet.description:
A playthrough of episode 1 of Disney Interactive's 1998 trivia game for PCs running Windows 95/98, The D Show.

"Everybody play The D Show!"

For anyone who grew up watching Disney, The D Show is an easy game to appreciate. It's a trivia game, similar in format to You Don't Know Jack!, complete with cheeky announcer and ridiculously high production values. 

And yes, that's Mark Elliot's voice!

It's set up as a TV show, and each episode is made of three rounds filled with questions on just about all things Disney. Stars, movies, television shows, park attractions: no matter how obscure, if you can think of it, it'll probably show up over the course of the 30 episodes included in the double-disc set. 

Every question is fully voiced, many of them use lengthy, high-quality video clips to provide clues, and since it's a Disney product, it's safe to assume that they aren't just throwaway fluff. They really make the experience. 

And that insipid theme song is so stupidly catchy! It'll become permanently lodged in your brain after just a few listens, guaranteed. 

Several years ago I uploaded a bit of the game and some people requested that I do the whole thing, so here we go! Each episode is about the same length as a half-hour TV program so I'll be posting them individually, but I'll putting them up on days where they won't interfere with my weekly Wednesday-through-Saturday upload schedule. 

And now, our featured presentation!
_____________
No cheats were used during the recording of this video. 

NintendoComplete (http://www.nintendocomplete.com/) punches you in the face with in-depth reviews, screenshot archives, and music from classic 8-bit NES games!
